title: 820-00426 has Green Light that turns Orange But no Fan Spin Not turning on.
message:
"Pin 3 = 0.00V"
Missing ACIN for U7100.

"Pin 1 = 15.86V
Pin 14 = 0.00V"
These are just the result of above mentioned; as missing PPBUS_G3H too.

"Getting 0.925 mOhms on Both sides of R7029"
If is diode medo to ground, you probably forgot to disconnect power...

Check R7110/11 and C7111.
If all OK, change U7100.

title: 820-00426 has Green Light that turns Orange But no Fan Spin Not turning on.
message: Okay Replaces U7100 and Got my Green/Orange light back and SYS ONEWIRE AND BC AKOK is Back But getting 1.09V on PPBUS_G3H, Still have 3.4V in PP3V42_G3H...trying to get the Values for R7110/R7111 and C7111 But I don?t have the schematics for the 820-00426 Just have the Schematics and Boardview for 820-00138...Does ANYBODY have them for the 820-00426?

title: 820-00426 has Green Light that turns Orange But no Fan Spin Not turning on.
message: ANYONE have any Suggestions?

title: 820-00426 has Green Light that turns Orange But no Fan Spin Not turning on.
message:
"trying to get the Values for R7110/R7111 and C7111"
Not needed now.
If you get SMC_BC_ACOK, then ACIN is good too.

Schematic not available, try using 00163.

Post real diode mode on PPBUS_G3H, without charger, nor battery; red probe at ground.

And post again voltage for the same pins of U7100.

title: 820-00426 has Green Light that turns Orange But no Fan Spin Not turning on.
message:
"PPBUS_G3H 4.40mOhm in Diode Mode With Red On Ground"
Impossible to get such reading on diode mode.
Please, set your DMM correctly; diode mode, not ohm mode!
Use manual one, you cannot get confused then.

"Pin 18. 1.830v
R7186
Pin 1 = 15.86V (Charger_Agate_Div)
Pin2 = 0.006V (Charger_Agate)"
Change Q7180...

title: 820-00426 has Green Light that turns Orange But no Fan Spin Not turning on.
message:
No boardview needed!
As per schematic, Q7180 is the only dual MOSFET (metal case) connected with F7005; and obviously with J7000.
Just follow the trace from power connector (with buzzer)...

title: 820-00426 has Green Light that turns Orange But no Fan Spin Not turning on.
message:
Your board could have two separated MOSFETs for this job.
Check if one beeps with power connector (PPDCIN_G3H) and the other one beeps with U7100 (pins 27/28).
The nearest big black resistor is probably R7120...

title: 820-00426 has Green Light that turns Orange But no Fan Spin Not turning on.
message:
Can you post voltage on the both black MOSFETs?
Specify voltage for pins.
Looking at schematic, Q7180 is "built" in your case with these two MOSFETs.
Cannot be such difficult to imagine what you need to do.
Probably one of them is bad; change both if you don't know  how to test.
I hope you can solder proper ones instead...

message: Why don't you try AON7403, or other P-channel MOSFET in the same case?

title: 820-00426 has Green Light that turns Orange But no Fan Spin Not turning on.
message:
If you don't see any on your scrap boards, then buy AON7403, FDMC6675, or other P-channel MOSFET with similar V/I parameters.
Why don't you remove them and check if are good?
Google can help you in any case...
